Detailed Description

Render texture.

Provides methods of rendering to a texture. This is intended for advanced effects, and is used by phoenix::PhLightManager.

See also:
phoenix::PhTexture

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phoenix::PhRenderTexture::PhRenderTexture ( PhRenderSystem *  r  ) 

Constructor.

Creates a new render texture and also creates a new texture to render to. The default size is 512x512.

Parameters:
r A pointer to the rendersystem.

phoenix::PhRenderTexture::PhRenderTexture ( PhRenderSystem *  r,
PhTexture *  t 
)

Constructor.

Creates a new render texture for rendering to the given texture.

Parameters:
r A pointer the rendersystem.
t A pointer to the texture to render to.

Member Function Documentation

void phoenix::PhRenderTexture::endRender (  ) 

End render.

Copies the backbuffer to the texture object, and then clears the screen.

PhTexture* phoenix::PhRenderTexture::getTexture (  ) 

Get texture.

Returns:
A pointer to the texture object.

void phoenix::PhRenderTexture::setTexture ( PhTexture *  t  ) 

Set texture.

Sets the texture that things are rendered to.

Parameters:
t A pointer to the new target texture.

void phoenix::PhRenderTexture::startRender (  ) 

Start render.

Performs all the steps needed to begin rendering objects to the texture. All geometry rendered after this call will not be render to the screen, but to the texture.

Note:
This function clears the screen.
